name: Cary Greenwood
body:
# CV

Prospective PhD Candidate, Data Scientist

mail: carywg@ucla.edu  
address: 5640 Franklin Ave #412, Los Angeles, CA 90028  
tel: +1 510 566 8568  

## Field of Interests:
Primary: Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, Blockchain, Clustering, Spatial Analysis  
Secondary: Transportation Analysis, Human Mobility, Urban Infrastructure  



## Education:

University of California, Los Angeles Bachelor of Geography 2010  
University of California, Los Angeles Minor of Geographic Information Systems 2010  


## Computer Skills:  

#### Data Analysis:
Apache Spark,
PySpark,
Apache Drill,
Python / Jupyter Notebooks,
Unix / Linux, 
SQL, 
R, 
Amazon Redshift, Amazon RDS, Amazon EC2, Amazon S3, 
Elasticsearch, 
PostgreSQL / PostGIS, Javascript

#### Spatial / Environmental Software:
QGIS, ESRI ArcGIS 9.x - 10.x ArcMap / ArcEditor / ArcInfo, ArcGIS Server, ESRI CityEngine, CityGML, Safe Software FME Spatial ETL, ENVI Remote Sensing, Stella Environmental Modeling, 

#### Design / Engineering Software:
Bentley Microstation, AutoCAD



## Work Experience:  
  
#### Verve Mobile, Carlsbad
Data Scientist / 2016 - Current
- Develop techniques to discover patterns in mobile device location data.
- Create frameworks to safeguard data integrity and quality.
- Write and utilize python scripts within Apache Spark to leverage datasets from internal and external sources.
- Design experiments, evaluate the quality of derived assets and develop continuous improvement roadmap. 
- Work with engineering and operational teams in the adoption of the derived assets for ad targeting, pre-sales/post-sales, reporting. 
- Use supervised and unsupervised machine learning libraries within R and Spark’s Mllib to model and predict GPS accuracy, device features and other signal attribution.
- Develop spatial and non-spatial visualization techniques for troubleshooting and problem solving.

Core Skills:  R, Pig, Hadoop, Apache Spark, Python / Jupyter Notebooks, Spark SQL, Yarn, PySpark, Python, Unix / Linux, Bash / Shell scripting, SQL, AWS, PostgreSQL / PostGIS, Javascript  

#### Verve Mobile, Carlsbad
Big Data Analyst / Engineer / 2014 - 2016
- As part of the Data Science team, conduct performance analysis, click fraud detection, attribution, spatial analysis, statistical analysis, development of key performance trends.
- Analyze complex data sets (from raw data) and develop meaningful, relevant insights backed by data
- Perform geographical/spatial analysis, probability, distribution, trends / statistical analysis, development of key performance metrics
- Develop supervised and unsupervised learning algorithms to be put into production
- Propose and integrate ad hoc and scalable data visualization platforms to be used company-wide 

Core Skills:  R, Pig, Hadoop, Apache Spark, Python / Jupyter Notebooks, Spark SQL, Yarn, PySpark, Python, Unix / Linux, Bash / Shell scripting, SQL, AWS, PostgreSQL / PostGIS, Javascript  


#### Arup, Los Angeles / New York
Spatial Data Analyst / 2011 - 2014
- Develop and lead spatial service consulting solutions nationally and internationally (Sydney, Toronto, London)
- Research and develop client applications based on the latest spatial technologies
- Setup, configure and implement hosted applications and databases.
- Analyze spatial datasets using PostgreSQL databases using SQL queries
- Lead and conduct in-house data management training
- Propose, budget and deliver data solutions for infrastructure projects from bidding to completion.
- Develop and manage funded research projects to integrate the latest technology
- Present best practices for data management and spatial services in staff wide meetings. 

Core Skills:  R, Python, Unix / Bash scripting, SQL, AWS, PostgreSQL / PostGIS, Javascript , ESRI ArcGIS 

#### University of California, Los Angeles
GIS/Remote Sensing Research Assistant / 2010 - 2010
- Assist Geography professors on research using GIS and remote sensing software (ENVI) to assess earthquake damages.
- Conduct image analysis through the use of density slice, contour lines, 3D modeling and animation.
- Digitize hard copy maps using satellite imagery resolutions and multi-band imagery.
- Geocode and processed raw data for mapping.
Core Skills:  ENVI , ESRI ArcGIS 

#### American Red Cross of Greater Los Angeles Chapter Headquarters
GIS Project Assistant
- Develop and implement GIS layers for web-GIS applications within the Disaster Services Human Resources (DSHR) department.
- Work with website administrators to update online map content through Javascript, PHP and Google API.
- Collaborate with Red Cross regional geospatial departments on maximizing staff efficiency.
Core Skills:  ESRI ArcGIS, Google Earth


## Conferences / Speaking:

- 22nd ACM SIGKDD Conference on Knowledge Discovery and Data Mining 2016
- ‘High-speed Rail Alignment Generation and Optimization Using GIS’ - American Railroad Engineering and Maintenance-of-Way Association 2013, Indianapolis, Indiana, Oct 1, 2013. 
- ‘AEC Planning with GIS’ - “High Speed Rail Alignment Generation and Optimization using GIS”. ESRI User Conference 2012, San Diego, California, July 25, 2012. 
- ‘How AEC Firms Leverage ArcGIS for Server’ - “Using ArcGIS Server for Real-Time Data Visualization”. ESRI User Conference 2012, San Diego, California, July 25, 2012. 


## Publications 

- ‘High-speed Rail Alignment Generation and Optimization Using GIS’ - American Railroad Engineering and Maintenance-of-Way Association 2013, Indianapolis, Indiana, Oct 1, 2013. 

#### Research, writing and editing support for: 
- New York State. NYS 2100 Commission. “Recommendations to Improve the Strength and Resilience of the Empire State’s Infrastructure.” 2013 

## Memberships & Affiliations  

- Association for Computing Machinery's Special Interest Group on Knowledge Discovery and Data Mining Member
- Member, Association of American Geographers (AAG) 
- Urban and Regional Information Systems Association (URISA) CalGIS member   

## Notable Projects  

- California High Speed Rail, Palmdale to Los Angeles Conducted analysis and created custom web applications, maps/plans for reports for the Palmdale to Los Angeles segment of the California high speed rail project and worked closely with joint venture partners to provide consultation on spatial solutions.  

- High Speed Rail Alignment, Phase 1 Held position of Transportation GIS Analyst for phase-1 high speed rail alignment feasibly study and collaborate with local counties to acquire land use data and understanding.  

- NYS 2100 Commission – Recommendations to Improve the Strength and Resilience of the Empire State’s Infrastructure In the process of preparing the Governor’s New York State 2100 Commission report, and as part of the Arup advisory team, Cary coordinated and advised a team of mapping experts from New York State’s leading agencies to compose the report’s mapping figures and images. Careful coordination of data, cartographic standards and mapping procedures was necessary in order to deliver mapping resources quickly and effectively. This report will be used to determine potential changes to New York State’s critical infrastructure over the coming century in the face of a changing climate.  

## Languages:
English - native
Spanish - basic  

## References:
Recommendations available upon request
